page.title: 18Markets
page.content: Banbury market is our nearest market. It is the biggest cattle market in Europe and it is busy every weekday. We also have a general market on Thursday and Saturday. Farmers go to market to buy and sell things.They sell them in areas known as rings.The men stand outside of the rings and bid for the animals that enter the ring.When animals get to the market they are all given a number, and put in a pen. There are different pens different types of animals:- the milking cows are all put in one pen. You can take any type of farm animal to market.The farmers get their animals to market in a lorry or cow box.When they get to market they drive into a loading bay to unload the animals. Sometimes the animals stay overnight in sheds. They also have fields to put big herds in.
